description: Full-text access to American Mathematical Society journals.

Datasets and visual tools on governance and corruption. Includes QoG Standard Dataset, Expert Survey, OECD subset, and EU regional data combining Eurostat and other sources.
County-level religious data reporting number of congregations and membership for participating faith groups. Datasets downloadable as tables or Excel files for multiple study years.
Research guide highlighting key electronic and print resources published by the U.S. Census Bureau and related sources.

dataset: University of Missouri Census Data Center's Geocorr 2014
description: Tool for creating CSV reports showing relationships between U.S. geographies (e.g., ZIP-to-county crosswalks). Useful for mapping how one geography nests within another.
Comprehensive democracy ratings and indicators. Latest dataset versions and documentation are available for free download.

dataset: Add Health (National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health)
description: Longitudinal, nationally representative cohort study of adolescents (grades 7–12 in 1994–95) followed into adulthood with extensive social, economic, psychological, and health measures.
Series of public opinion surveys conducted for the European Commission since 1973 on a wide range of EU-related topics.
Nationally representative cross-sectional survey of the U.S. population since 1972 collecting data on social attitudes, behaviors, and opinions with a stable replicating core to track trends.
Same as General Social Survey entry; full data and documentation available via NORC.

dataset: National Survey of Families and Households
description: Longitudinal survey collecting detailed life-history information on marriage, cohabitation, fertility, employment, and economic well-being across multiple waves.
Survey on family life, marriage/divorce, pregnancy, infertility, contraception, and men's and women's health.
Pew Research Center datasets from surveys on politics, society, technology, religion, and demographics; data files available for download.

dataset: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)
description: Data on political violence and protests, with geographic, temporal, and actor-level detail for developing and other regions.
Datasets on interstate and intrastate conflict, dyadic interactions, militarized disputes, and related international conflict measures.
Quantitative index measuring levels of peace across countries and regions using multiple indicators of safety and security.
Open-source database documenting terrorist events worldwide from 1970 through 2017 (and updated releases on GTD site).
Databases and datasets on arms transfers, military expenditure, the arms industry, and multilateral peace operations.
Data on armed conflicts, conflict trends, and peace agreements maintained by the Uppsala Conflict Data Program.
